sources.title: "Girls Taking Time Checks" (1904) cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "Girls Taking Time Checks" is a very short documentary.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of Billy Bitzer. The film is part of the series "Westinghouse Works" (1904), which was added to the National Film Registry in 1998 as being deemed "culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant". Let's all give our thanks to the Library of Congress for preserving this film and making it available to the public. Directed by                       unknown Cinematography by         Billy Bitzer Starring                             unknown Distributed by                   Biograph Company Release date                      May 6, 1904 Country                             United States Running time                    3 m. metadata.Plot: Almost 200 women file by a device on the wall from which they take their time checks. A man runs half-way across the screen at the end of the film.
